metadata.title: CVE-2016-2811 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
Use-after-free vulnerability in the ServiceWorkerInfo class in the ServiceWorker subsystem in Mozilla Firefox before 46.0 allows remote attackers toexecute arbitrary code via vectors related to the BeginReading method.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-2811` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 46.0+build5-0ubuntu0.14.04.2
firefox-globalmenu - 46.0+build5-0ubuntu0.14.04.2
firefox-mozsymbols - 46.0+build5-0ubuntu0.14.04.2
firefox-testsuite - 46.0+build5-0ubuntu0.14.04.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '46.0+build5-0ubuntu0.14.04.2').
